Class driver

java.lang.Object
driver
public class driver
extends java.lang.Object

Kevin Ve 40032669

COMP249

Assignment 1

Due Date: January 31, 2020

Main driver class

User manages an inventory of Appliances with 5 different actions to be chosen at a main menu.

  1. Create new Appliances
  2. Edit an existing Appliance
  3. Display list of Appliances under a brand
  4. Display list of Appliances under a certain price
  5. Exit program

User must pass a password check for menu choices 1 and 2.

Author:
KevinVe
See Also:
Appliance

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

    • passCheck

      public static boolean passCheck​(java.lang.String password, int MAX_ATTEMPTS, java.util.Scanner keyIn)
      Asks user for password with a maximum number of attempts allowed.
      Parameters:
      password - The correct password to be compared with
      MAX_ATTEMPTS - Maximum number of allowed attempts
      keyIn - Used for input
      Returns:
      true if password is correct. false if password entered failed MAX_ATTEMPT times

    • validateInput

      public static int validateInput​(int max, java.util.Scanner keyIn)
      Asks user for a valid integer as defined by being between 0 and a given maximum
      Parameters:
      max - Maximum int to be compared
      keyIn - Used for input
      Returns:
      int between 0 and max

    • validateType

      public static Appliance.Type validateType​(java.util.Scanner keyIn)
      Asks user for a type. Loops it until user enters a valid type or quits
      Parameters:
      keyIn - Used for input
      Returns:
      Appliance.Type
      See Also:
      List of valid types

    • createNewAppliances

      public static void createNewAppliances​(Appliance[] inventory, int inventoryCount, java.util.Scanner keyIn)
      Menu Option 1 creates a new appliance and puts it in the inventory array
      Parameters:
      inventory - Array of appliances to hold new appliance
      inventoryCount - Used as index of next empty element for the new appliance
      keyIn - Used for inputs

    • editAppliance

      public static void editAppliance​(Appliance[] inventory, long serialNumber, java.util.Scanner keyIn)
      Menu Option 2 edits an appliance given the inventory and a valid serial number
      Parameters:
      inventory - Array of appliances including appliance to be edited
      serialNumber - Serial number of appliance to be edited
      keyIn - Used for inputs

    • displayMainMenu

      public static void displayMainMenu()
      Prints main menu to console

    • getIndexOfAppliance

      public static int getIndexOfAppliance​(Appliance[] a, long serial)
      Gets the index of an appliance in a array for usage Returns -1 if serial number of appliance does not exist in the inventory
      Parameters:
      a - Appliance[] to be searched through
      serial - Serial number to be used for search
      Returns:
      index of Appliance in an Appliance[] of a serial number. If serial number doesnt exist then return -1
